definition: to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In fact, there is nothing in this part of the policy adjustment speculators.
sentences.chinese: 政策调整其实对这部分炒家没什么影响。

sentences.english: And the phasing out of the property market speculators, is what can be expected.
sentences.chinese: 而楼市大炒家的逐步撤出，已经是可以预期的事情。

sentences.english: Actually, the real is the second in the individual speculators.
sentences.chinese: 其实，真正的炒家是第二批进驻的散客。

sentences.english: Strange disappearance of major inside players on Wall Street this week.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街的主要业内炒家本周离奇失踪。

sentences.english: In the last couple of years, the speculators made the call, and every year there were dramatic changes in price.
sentences.chinese: 这两年是炒家决定，而且每年价格都有很大变化。

sentences.english: Over the past three decades, the stock market has come to be dominated by a herd of professional investors.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的三十多年，股票市场由一群职业炒家主宰。

definition: hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
financial leverage/leveraging (i.e. buying shares on borrowed funds)
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)
Soros (name)/George Soros or György Schwartz (1930-), Hungarian American financial speculator and millionaire philanthropist
